üåå ORBIS BRAND CONCEPT EVOLUTIONS
üîµ 1. Orbis Core
‚ÄúThe center of intelligent systems.‚Äù

Circular, recursive, fundamental. This name embodies the philosophical nucleus of Orbis ‚Äî a semantic engine driving governance, memory, AI interaction, and system orchestration.
‚ú¥Ô∏è Core Themes:
‚Ä¢ Cognition loops (Hofstadter‚Äôs ‚ÄúStrange Loop‚Äù)
‚Ä¢ Autopoiesis ‚Äî systems that regenerate themselves
‚Ä¢ Governance kernel ‚Äî a semantic OS at the heart of digital infrastructure
‚Ä¢ Circular logic ‚Üí Rational coherence ‚Üí Auditability
üåà Visual Mood:
‚Ä¢ Minimalist, high-contrast
‚Ä¢ Monoline circle glyphs / stacked concentric rings
‚Ä¢ Echoes of operating system boot loaders or schematic cores
üî§ Logo Direction:
‚Ä¢ Stylised ‚ÄúO‚Äù with pulsing center
‚Ä¢ Typography: geometric sans (e.g., Space Grotesk / Inter / Satoshi)
‚Ä¢ Variant: 0rbis Core (logo glyph only)
üî• 2. Orbis Forge
‚ÄúThe intelligence foundry.‚Äù

Symbolic of both heat and transformation, Forge reflects a platform where AI and human intent co-create new systems. It's not passive ‚Äî it‚Äôs molten, shaping intelligence like ancient smiths shaped metal.
‚ú¥Ô∏è Core Themes:
‚Ä¢ Techno-alchemy ‚Äî crafting AI tools from raw prompts and system intent
‚Ä¢ Industrial ‚Üí Digital revolution parallel
‚Ä¢ Agentic systems forged into tools, protocols, workflows
‚Ä¢ Signals to founders, builders, and creators
üåà Visual Mood:
‚Ä¢ Warm copper / forged steel tones
‚Ä¢ Hammer-and-spark motifs
‚Ä¢ Glowing ember or furnace-core visuals
‚Ä¢ Modular UI ‚Äúingots‚Äù that combine into features
üî§ Logo Direction:
‚Ä¢ Wordmark with flare accents on ‚ÄúF‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Symbol: Anvil + Orbit, or ‚ÄúO‚Äù encircling a flame glyph
‚Ä¢ Font: Sturdy but refined ‚Äî consider Degular, Neue Haas, Founders Grotesk
üîÅ 3. Orbis Loop (Honourable Mention)
‚ÄúI am a strange loop.‚Äù

A self-observing system. Less grounded than Core or Forge, but poetic and AI-native.
Could be used as a product or feature name later (e.g., Orbis Loop: Lifecycle Autopilot)
üß¨ SHARED DESIGN SYSTEM ELEMENTS (All Variants)
üß† Voice & Language:ElementStyleCopyControlled, system-aware, semanticTonePrecision with calm clarityAgents‚ÄúForged intelligence‚Äù (Forge), ‚ÄúCore threads‚Äù (Core)
üé® Shared Color FoundationRoleColorBackground#0C0C0E (Obsidian Black)Accent A#D77B28 (Copper Ember ‚Äì Forge)Accent B#1C5D99 (Nebula Blue ‚Äì Core)Surface#F2F0E6 (Lumen Cream)Status#3FB8AF (Signal Teal)Trace Layer#B3B6B7 (Orbit Gray)
üß© Shared UI Concepts
‚Ä¢ Governance Thread View ‚Üí Like metal wire drawn through structure
‚Ä¢ Prompt Console = Foundry Surface (Forge) or Semantic Kernel (Core)
‚Ä¢ Visual Tags = alloy tokens / stackable schema
‚Ä¢ Runtime Indicators = heat map (Forge) or pulse ring (Core)

üì¶ Overview
This document summarizes the implementation and governance outcomes of WT Phase 3.x, covering Phases WT-3.0 to WT-3.3. The purpose of Phase 3.x is to establish robust developer infrastructure, CI/CD automation, and governance-enforced quality controls across the Wombat Track platform.
‚úÖ Phase Breakdown
WT-3.0 ‚Äì Architecture Reconciliation
Status: ‚úÖ Complete Summary:
‚Ä¢ Refactored orbis-* naming to wombat-console
‚Ä¢ Unified phase hierarchy under WT naming
‚Ä¢ Enhanced UX vertical nesting: Project > Phase > Step

üìò Session Summary
This session surfaced and resolved critical Git integrity, sidebar recovery, and CI build reliability issues. The robustness of these workflows is essential for the long-term viability of the MetaPlatform and Wombat Track as an AI-governed SDLC nucleus.

üåü Purpose
Establish Wombat Track as its own project governance and management environment ‚Äî tracking the WT app‚Äôs own evolution within the WT platform.
This project formalises the goal of replacing local artefacts and external documentation with WT-native project management, execution, and governance capabilities.
üß≠ Strategic Goal
Migrate all planning, execution, documentation, and governance activities of the WT app into the WT platform itself.
Wombat Track must be used to manage Wombat Track.
üìò Project SummaryElementDescriptionProject NameWT Self-Managed App MigrationLeadGizmo (AI) + JacksonStart Date2025-07-25Statusüü° In ProgressGovernanceLog Ref"Self-Management Initiative" (Proposal + Phase Logs)
üß† Governance Hooks
‚Ä¢ Proposal: WT should manage itself.
‚Ä¢ Decisions: Logged at each project intake and schema change.
‚Ä¢ Changes: Linked to data model PRs.
‚Ä¢ Reviews: Every feature must have its own GovernanceLog.
üõ°Ô∏è Integrity Requirements
‚Ä¢ Every WT feature/project must be traceable in WT.
‚Ä¢ No markdown-only artefacts should exist outside WT unless exported.
‚Ä¢ Claude and Gizmo must both log AI actions to GovernanceLog.
‚úÖ Blocker CheckAreaStatusNotesData Model‚ùå IncompleteNeeds 3 new data types + extensionsUI Surfaces‚ö†Ô∏è PartialMostly functional, needs richer metadata fieldsGovernance Logging‚úÖ CompleteJust needs more usageAI Prompt Hooks‚úÖ AvailableClaude and Gizmo ready to trigger create/import
üîö Output Goals
‚Ä¢ Every active WT artefact tracked as WT project
‚Ä¢ Self-documented change history
‚Ä¢ MetaPlatform fully monitored from within WT
‚Ä¢ WT becomes a self-reflexive governance operating system

This phase enables real-time visibility into AI agent activity (Claude and Gizmo) within the Orbis UI. It includes UI enhancements to display agent status, last prompt time, and activity metrics. Backend tracking of `agentStatus`, `lastPromptTime`, and `responseTime` will feed the console and support future runtime diagnostics. Designed to improve user trust and enable runtime orchestration for the Vision Layer.
